title.narrative: Kenya - Integrated Social and Behaviour Change Communication for Covid-19 Response

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to enable the Kenya Conference of Catholic Bishops through the National Justice and Peace Commission to; Contribute to Enhanced awareness on Covid-19 pandemic in 15 Dioceses (Nairobi, Kisumu, Mombasa, Nyeri, Nakuru, Eldoret, Marsabit, Lodwar, Isiolo, Muranga, Kitale, Kitui, Embu and Maralal). This will be accomplished through 1. Conduct 15 Radio Awareness Campaigns and Interviews 2. Conduct 14 public awareness campaigns in Nairobi’s ten informal settlements (Kibera, Mathare, Kayole, Dandora, Baba Ndogo, Fuata Nyayo, Huruma, Kawangware, Kangemi, Kariobangi) and Kisumu’s four infornal settlements (Kondele, Nyawita, Obunga and Nyalenda) 3. Conduct Social Media and internet awareness campaigns through the national office and diocesan websites, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube 4. Conduct awareness campaigns using Posters, Murals and Graffiti. The project targets mainly informal settlements in Nairobi and Kisumu Counties. Specifically, the project targets the following; - Approximately 600,000 Nairobi and Kisumu slums population - 15 Dioceses - Commissions/departments staff at KCCB - KCCB Diocesan Coordinators - Targeted parishes - Marginalised communities - General Kenya public - Youth
